data.title: P Bohrmann
data.meta_description: Gabrielle of Coco Chanel P.Horst Gelatine Silver Print Photo Postcard and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Condition: As New. AHOP - This is a stunning collectors opportunity to secure this original undated but modern origin VA& Museum photo souvenir by historic photographer Horst P Horst of Gabrielle from Coco Chanel with full details of the Gelatin Silver Print 1937 work on reverse and the V&A official museum logo too unused and mint condition.Born in Germany as Horst Paul Albert Bohrmann, Horst studied design and carpentry under the tuition of Walter Gropius, founder of the Bauhaus School, before moving to Paris to work as an apprentice to architect Le Corbusier. In Paris, he met George Hoyningen-Huene, star photographer at French Vogue. Huene became Horst's mentor, inviting him into the creative world of 1930s Paris.

Harjes, H.-P. & Krummel, H.: Combined processing of seismic reflection and borehole measurements in the Moroccan basin offshore NW-Africa at DSDP-Site 416. Hinz, K., Fritsch, J., Kempter, E. H. K., Manaf Mohammad, A., Meyer, J., Mohamed, D., Vosberg, H., Weber, J. & Benavidez, J.: Thrust tectonics along the north-western continental margin of Sabah/Borneo. Erzinger, J.: Chemical alteration of the oceanic crust. Geiss, E., Petersen, N. & Bleil, U.: Amplitude variation of marine magnetic anomalies. Vali, H., von Dobeneck, T., Amaratidis, G., Förster, O., Morteani, G., Bachmann, L. & Petersen, N.: Biogenic and lithogenic magnetic minerals in Atlantic and Pacific deep sea sediments and their paleomagnetic significance. Hobert, L. A. & Wetzel, A.: On the relationship between slicia and carbonate diagenesis in deep-sea sediments. Bohrmann, G., Stein, R. & Faugères, J.-C.: Authigenic zeolites and their relation to silica diagenesis in ODP Site 661 sediments (leg 108, Eastern Equatorial Atlantic). Wiesner, M. G., Wong, H. K. & Degens, E. T.: Provenance and diagenesis of organic matter in Late Cretaceous and Tertiary sediments from the southern Black Sea margin. Bayer, U. & Wetzel, A.: Compactional behavior of fine-grained sediments - examples from Deep Sea Drilling Project cores. Einsele, G.: In-situ water contents, liquid limits, and submarine mass flows due to a high liquefaction potential of slope sediments (results from DSDP and subaerial counterparts). Ten Haven, H. L., Rullkötter, J. & Welte, D. H.: Steroid biological marker hydrocarbons as indicators of organic matter diagenesis in Deep Sea sediments: geochemical reactions and influence of different heat flow regimes. Brumsack, H. J.: Geochemistry of recent TOC-rich sediments from the Gulf of California and the Black Sea. Stein, R., Rullkötter, J. & Welte, D. H.: Changes in paleoenvironments in the Atlantic Ocean during Cretaceous times: results from black shales studies. Rothe, P.: Mineral composition of sedimentary formations in the North Atlantic Ocean. Hartmann, M., Segl, M., Mangini, A., Beer, J., Bonani, G., Suter, M. & Wölfli, W.: The manganese nodules of the Kane Gap (East Atlantic). Indicators of sedimentation - erosion changes. Diester-Haass, L. & Schnitker, D.: Plio-Pleistocene sedimentation regimes leading to chalk-marl-cycles in the North Atlantic (DSDP Site 552 - Hole 552A). Beiersdorf, H.: Provenance and accumulation rates of Pliocene and Quaternary sediments from the western Coral Sea. Riegraf, W. & Luterbacher, H.: Oberjura-Foraminiferen aus dem Nord- und Südatlantik (Deep Sea Drilling Project Leg 1-79). Riegraf, W.: Benthonische Schelf-Foraminiferen aus dem Valanginium-Hauterivium (Unterkreide) des Indischen Ozeans südwestlich Madagaskar (Deep Sea Drilling Project Leg 25, Site 249). Riegraf, W. & Luterbacher, H.: Benthonische Foraminiferen aus der Unterkreide des "Deep Sea Drilling Project" (Leg 1-79). Kuhnt, W., Kaminski, M. A. & Moullade, M.: Late Cretaceous deep-water agglutinated foraminiferal assemblages from the North Atlantic and its marginal seas. Riegraf, W. & Luterbacher, H.: Jurassic and Cretaceous Rhyncholites (Cephalopod Jaws) from the North Atlantic Drilling Projects Leg 1-79) and their European Counterparts. Evidence for the Uniformity of the Western Tethys. Locker, S. & Martini, E.: Phytoliths at DSDP Site 591 in the southwest Pacific and the aridification of Australia. Bleil, U. & Gard, G.: Chronology and correlation of Quaternary magnetostratigraphy and nannofossil biostratigraphy in Norwegian-Greenland Sea sediments. von Rad, U., Thurow, J., Haq, B. U. & Gradstein, F. & Ludden, J.: Triassic to Venozoic evolution of the NW Australian continental margin and the birth of the Indian Ocean (preliminary results of ODP Legs 122 and 123). 522 pp., num. figs, br. gr. 8 [with some markings in the text].

Hardcover. Terracotta cloth/boards; gilt lettering to spine and front cover. Missing dust jacket. 133 pp. full of bw portraits. Preface by Dr. M. Agha. Stunning bw photos of actors, military personnel, French couture, and more. Horst Paul Albert Bohrmann (August 14, 1906 - November 18, 1999) who chose to be known as Horst P. Horst was a German-American fashion photographer. Good. A tight copy with no extraneous marks but some soiling, especially to covers. Former owner's name on ffep (Edgar Munhall, first curator of The Frick); inscribed/signed by Horst to "Robert" on the half title. Original Edition; Presumed First; Inscribed/Signed.
